riddles_list.riddles: There are several books on a bookshelf. If one book is the 4th from the left and 6th from the right, how many books are on the shelf?
A duck was given $9, a spider was given $36, and a bee was given $27. How much money would be give to a cat?
I am a three-digit number. My tens digit is six more than my ones digit. My hundreds digit is eight less than my tens digit. What number am I?
What occurs twice a WEEK, once a YEAR, but never in a DAY?
Jason is 54 years old and his mother is 80, how many years ago was Jason's mother three times her age?
What number do you get when you multiply all of the numbers on a telephone's number pad?
A grandfather, two fathers, and two sons went to the movie theater together and everyone bought one movie ticket each. How many tickets did they buy in total?
Amy is four times as old as me. In 20 years, I shall be twice as old as her. How old am I now?
If Nancy can paint a house in 4 hours, and Max can paint the same house in 6 hours. How long will it take for both to paint a house? Answer in minutes.
Two people in front of two people, two people behind two people, and two people beside two people. How many people are there?

An airplane flies against the wind from A to B in 8 hours. The same airplane returns from B to A in the same direction as the wind, in 7 hours. Find the ratio of the speed of the airplane to the speed of the wind.
There are twelve kids in a classroom. Six kids are wearing socks and 4 are wearing shoes. Three kids are wearing both. How many kids are bare feet?
The product of two consecutive negative even integers is 24. What is the smaller of the two numbers?
